problem.p: Two types of tetherballs are shown above. In both pictures, a small ball is attached by a string to a post of radius r. The ball is initially at a distance R from the center of the post (point Q) and moving with a speed v.

On the left, the string simply wraps around the outside of the post. On the right, the string passes trough a hole in the center of the post. The string is gradually shortened by pulling it slowly so that the ball gets closer to the post.(Ignore gravity in both cases).
Consider the system to be the ball. During the time interval it takes the ball to hit the post, choose one of these options for each statement.
A. True for the left case only
B. True for the right case only

optionresponse.p: Angular momentum about point Q is conserved.

problem.p: For the left picture, what is the speed of the ball right before when it hits the post?
For the right picture, what is the speed of the ball right when it hits the post?
